title: India's Star Health confirms data breach after cybercriminals post customers' health data online
summary: Star Health and Allied Insurance, a major Indian health insurance company, has acknowledged suffering a cyberattack that resulted in customer health records and sensitive data being exposed online by cybercriminals.
content:
Star Health and Allied Insurance, one of the largest health insurance firms in India, has confirmed it was the target of a "malicious cyberattack," some two weeks after cybercriminals claimed to post customers' health records and other sensitive data online. The incident raises serious concerns about data privacy and security in India's growing digital insurance sector.

The breach was discovered after cybercriminals began posting what appeared to be confidential customer information, including health records and personal data, on various online platforms. This unauthorized access to sensitive healthcare information poses significant risks for affected customers.

The company has stated it is working with cybersecurity experts and relevant authorities to investigate the incident and enhance its security measures. The full extent of the data compromise and the number of affected customers remains unclear.
